messageBody:
Hi Ron,

I know I am not answering your exact question and this may not be an option
but...
When I am faced with the problem that I need to load an external file in my
tests
I use the resource mechanism in Java like this:

URL url1 = getClass().getResource("
aClassPathResourceInTheSameLocationAsMyTest.res");
URL url2 = getClass().getResource("/aResourceInTheClassPathRoot.res");

If you want a stream you can substitute getResource for getResourceStream
if you want a file from a URL you can use:

File file = new File(url1.getUri()); // works in java 1.4 and later

Would this work in your case?


To adress your exact question you can set the working directory in your
launch-config in eclipse
for your jUnit-test.

1. run|open run dialog...
2. select your JUnit launch or create a new one.
3. under the arguments tab you can enter the working directory. The
predefined one is the project root.

I personally don't like this option because you will have to make the same
setting on all developer machines (unless you share launches via your vcs)
and if you want to run
a single test you will have to configure the new launch again... a bit
tedious...

I hope this helps.
/J
